object.name: Device.UserInterface.
object.description: This object contains parameters relating to the user interface of the CPE.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables and disables the CPE's user interface.

parameter.name: PasswordRequired
parameter.description:
Present only if the CPE provides a password-protected LAN-side user interface.
Indicates whether or not the local user interface MUST require a password to be chosen by the user. If {{false}}, the choice of whether or not a password is used is left to the user.

parameter.name: PasswordUserSelectable
parameter.description:
Present only if the CPE provides a password-protected LAN-side user interface and supports LAN-side Auto-Configuration.
Indicates whether or not a password to protect the local user interface of the CPE MAY be selected by the user directly (i.e. {{param|#.Users.User.{i}.Password}}), or MUST be equal to the password used by the LAN-side Auto-Configuration protocol (i.e. {{param|#.LANConfigSecurity.ConfigPassword}}).

parameter.name: UpgradeAvailable
parameter.description: Indicates that a CPE upgrade is available, allowing the CPE to display this information to the user.

parameter.name: WarrantyDate
parameter.description: Indicates the date and time in UTC that the warranty associated with the CPE is to expire.

parameter.name: ISPName
parameter.description: The name of the customer's ISP.

parameter.name: ISPHelpDesk
parameter.description: The help desk phone number of the ISP.

parameter.name: ISPHomePage
parameter.description: The {{datatype}} of the ISP's home page.

parameter.name: ISPHelpPage
parameter.description: The {{datatype}} of the ISP's on-line support page.

parameter.name: ISPLogo
parameter.description: Base64 encoded GIF or JPEG image. The binary image is constrained to 4095 bytes or less.

parameter.name: ISPLogoSize
parameter.description:
Un-encoded binary image size in bytes.
If ISPLogoSize input value is 0 then the ISPLogo is cleared.
ISPLogoSize can also be used as a check to verify correct transfer and conversion of Base64 string to image size.

parameter.name: ISPMailServer
parameter.description: The {{datatype}} of the ISP's mail server.

parameter.name: ISPNewsServer
parameter.description: The {{datatype}} of the ISP's news server.

parameter.name: TextColor
parameter.description: The color of text on the GUI screens in RGB hexadecimal notation (e.g., FF0088).

parameter.name: BackgroundColor
parameter.description: The color of the GUI screen backgrounds in RGB hexadecimal notation (e.g., FF0088).

parameter.name: ButtonColor
parameter.description: The color of buttons on the GUI screens in RGB hexadecimal notation (e.g., FF0088).

parameter.name: ButtonTextColor
parameter.description: The color of text on buttons on the GUI screens in RGB hexadecimal notation (e.g., FF0088).

parameter.name: AutoUpdateServer
parameter.description: The server the CPE can check to see if an update is available for direct download to it.

parameter.name: UserUpdateServer
parameter.description: The server where a user can check via a web browser if an update is available for download to a PC.

parameter.name: AvailableLanguages
parameter.description: {{list}} List items represent user-interface languages that are available, where each language is specified according to {{bibref|RFC3066}}.

parameter.name: CurrentLanguage
parameter.description: Current user-interface language, specified according to {{bibref|RFC3066}}. The value MUST be a member of the list reported by the {{param|AvailableLanguages}} parameter.

parameter.name: HTTPAccessSupportedProtocols
parameter.description: Indicates the protocols that are supported by the CPE for the purpose of remotely accessing the user interface.

parameter.name: HTTPAccessNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.UserInterface.HTTPAccess.{i}.
object.description:
HTTPAccess is used for modeling the different web interfaces that may be either localy or remotely available in the device. For example with Software Modules it is possible to install multiple services that embed a web interface like a ''Video service'' or ''Photo service''.
An instance of the {{object}} can model a web interface that is embedded in the device firmware or installed through a Software Modules management system.
Access to the web interface MAY require user authentication. To have access authentication the device MUST support a {{object|.Users.User.}} object with at least one instance and an assigned relevant role in {{param|.Users.User.{i}.RoleParticipation}}.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables/disables web interface.

parameter.name: Order
Status
parameter.description: Status of web interface.

enumeration.description: Indicates that the web interface is enabled and working.
Indicates that the web interface is disabled and thus not working.
MAY be used by the web interface to indicate a locally defined error condition.

parameter.name: AccessType
parameter.description: This parameter describes the possible access types.

enumeration.description: Indicates that the web interface should be used for remote access. Remote access is defined as any entity not on a local subnet attempting to connect to the device.
Indicates that the web interface should be used for local access.

parameter.name: AllowedRoles
parameter.description: Only allow users, defined in {{object|.Users.User.}}, to access the web instance represented by this {{object}} instance that have the following roles assigned that are defined in {{object|.Users.Role.}}.

parameter.name: Certificate
parameter.description: Points to the server certificate to be presented by the web interface. Only required when {{param|Protocol}} is set to ''HTTPS''.

parameter.name: CACertificate
parameter.description: Points to the CA certificate that must be used by the web interface. The {{param}} is used to validate the web client certificate. {{param|Protocol}} MUST be set to ''HTTPS''.

parameter.name: Interface
Port
parameter.description: Listen port number.

parameter.name: Protocol
parameter.description: Protocol being used.

parameter.name: AllowedHosts
parameter.description:
Specifies which hostnames are permitted to be served by the web interface.
This could be done by comparing the Host: HTTP header in an incoming request which will result in the request being routed to this instance, in the case that the device supports Virtual Hosting.
If this string is empty then this instance acts as a "default" host, i.e. it will handle requests for which the Host header does not match any other instance.

parameter.name: AllowedPathPrefixes
parameter.description: Each string must be a partial path which will result in an incoming request being routed to this instance.

parameter.name: AutoDisableDuration
parameter.description:
Indicates in {{units}} when the web interface will be automatically disabled. When ''0'' is specified, the web interface will not be automatically disabled.
For example if the web interface is to be active for only 30 minutes, then this parameter would be set to 1800 {{units}}.

parameter.name: TimeLeft
parameter.description:
The number of {{units}} remaining before the web interface will be disabled. ''0'' means that the web interface is disabled or no {{param|AutoDisableDuration}} was specified.
Example: The {{param|AutoDisableDuration}} parameter has been set to 1800 seconds and the web interface was enabled 600 seconds ago. This means that the {{param}} will return 1200 seconds, which is the remaining time before the web interface will be disabled.

parameter.name: ActivationDate
parameter.description: Indicates when the web interface was enabled.

parameter.name: SessionNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.UserInterface.HTTPAccess.{i}.Session.{i}.
object.description:
Web server session list.
Note: This parameter was demoted to readOnly in the Device:2.17 version.

parameter.name: SessionID
parameter.description: Session identifier.

parameter.name: User
parameter.description:
The user to whom the session belongs. When the user is unknown {{empty}} string SHOULD be used.
Note: This parameter was demoted to readOnly in the Device:2.17 version.

parameter.name: IPAddress
parameter.description: The IP address of the remote web client, connected to the web interface.

parameter.name: Port
parameter.description: Port number of the remote web client, connected to the web interface.

parameter.name: Protocol
parameter.description: Protocol being used.

parameter.name: StartDate
parameter.description: Indicates when the session was created.

object.name: Device.UserInterface.RemoteAccess.
object.description:
This object contains parameters relating to remotely accessing the CPE's user interface.
Remote access is defined as any entity not of a local subnet attempting to connect to the CPE.
Remote access requires user authentication. To provide remote access authentication the CPE MUST support a "User" table with at least one instance that has "RemoteAccessCapable" set to {{true}}.
{{deprecated|2.16|due to the introduction of {{object|#.HTTPAccess}}}}

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables/Disables remotely accessing the CPE's user interface.

parameter.name: Port
parameter.description: Destination TCP port required for remote access connection.

parameter.name: SupportedProtocols
parameter.description: {{list}} Indicates the protocols that are supported by the CPE for the purpose of remotely accessing the user interface.

parameter.name: Protocol
parameter.description: This is the protocol currently being used for remote access.

object.name: Device.UserInterface.LocalDisplay.
object.description: This object describes how to remotely manage the initial positioning of a user interface on a device's local display.

parameter.name: Movable
parameter.description: Controls whether the user is allowed to change the GUI window position on the local CPE's display.

parameter.name: Resizable
parameter.description: Controls whether the user is allowed to resize the GUI window on the local CPE's display.

parameter.name: PosX
parameter.description: The horizontal position of the User Interface's top left corner within the local CPE's display measured from the top left corner, expressed in {{units}}.

parameter.name: PosY
parameter.description: The vertical position of the User Interface's top left corner within the local CPE's display measured from the top left corner, expressed in {{units}}.

parameter.name: Width
parameter.description: The width of the user interface within the local CPE's display, expressed in {{units}}.

parameter.name: Height
parameter.description: The height of the user interface within the local CPE's display, expressed in {{units}}.

parameter.name: DisplayWidth
parameter.description: The width of the local CPE's display, expressed in {{units}}.

parameter.name: DisplayHeight
parameter.description: The height of the local CPE's display, expressed in {{units}}.

object.name: Device.UserInterface.Messages.
object.description: Definition of user information message displays.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables and displays the user information message.

parameter.name: Title
parameter.description: Message title to be displayed.

parameter.name: SubTitle
parameter.description: Message sub title to be displayed.

parameter.name: Text
parameter.description: Message text.

parameter.name: IconType
parameter.description: Icon to be displayed.

parameter.name: MessageColor
parameter.description: The color of message text in RGB hexadecimal notation (e.g., FF0088).

parameter.name: BackgroundColor
parameter.description: The color of the message screen background in RGB hexadecimal notation (e.g., FF0088).

parameter.name: TitleColor
parameter.description: The color of the message title in RGB hexadecimal notation (e.g., FF0088).

parameter.name: SubTitleColor
parameter.description: The color of the sub title in RGB hexadecimal notation (e.g., FF0088).

parameter.name: RequestedNumberOfRepetitions
parameter.description: The number of times the device SHOULD repeat the message.

parameter.name: ExecutedNumberOfRepetitions
parameter.description: The number of times the device repeated the message.
